subject: Re: [junit] Junit and JDK 1.4.2
msgSnippet: On Thu, 04 Sep 2003 19:00:53 +0530, Ranjeet Sahay  ... Ranjeet, I believe this question is a FAQ... The answer is to use assertTrue(...)
messageBody:
On Thu, 04 Sep 2003 19:00:53 +0530, "Ranjeet Sahay" <rsahay@...>
said:
> Hi,
>
> Working on JUnit on JDK 1.4.2 it gives certain warning about assert
> methods.
> I know this method has been introduced from JDK1.4 onwards.
> Should they affect my JUnit assertion in anyway?

Ranjeet,

I believe this question is a FAQ... The answer is to use assertTrue(...)
instead of assert(...). There is a shell script (which can also be run
in Cygwin if you are a Windows user) at
http://scgwiki.iam.unibe.ch:8080/SCG/385 that will convert your files for
you.

--
=jason
[:question | ^One]
